intro: Your task is to respond to Mrs Bingham who is feeling depressed and withdrawn. She has stopped attending activities, has trouble sleeping, and is reluctant about medication. Provide empathetic support, encourage her to share her feelings, and reinforce the importance of her GP referral.
description_html:
This scenario focuses on supporting a resident experiencing depression. You will practice providing empathetic emotional support within your scope as a care assistant.

Learning objectives:

  • Recognize signs of depression
  • Provide empathetic listening and support
  • Encourage professional help (GP referral)
  • Respect concerns about medication
  • Understand the limits of your role in mental health

resident.name: Mrs Bingham
goals: express sadness and lack of motivation
report problem ongoing for some time
disclose poor sleep (short duration, early waking)
agree to talk to carers when feeling low
must_disclose: feels sad most of the time

safety.if_red_flag_then: encourage empathy, reinforce GP/nurse referral, monitor closely for deterioration

actions.title: Sit with resident
actions.prompt: You sit down beside Mrs Bingham to show you have time to listen and provide a supportive presence.

actions.title: Confirm GP referral
actions.prompt: You acknowledge the GP referral arranged by the nurse and explain that professional support can really help.
